replies.author: @John_.Cabell_.Breckinridge
replies.text: @studio1988. Went to Porlamar in 2016 and 2024, felt like 2 completely different places. In 2016 the Obama admin imposed sanctions and things for that island went downhill, the hotel I stayed at had water rationing and it wasn't that bad compared to some hotels that didn't even have full time electricity. Went back in 2024 after some sanctions were lifted and you could feel the difference

replies.author: @TheDarthSebas
replies.text:
@presterjohn1697¬† also peculiar that successful "socialist" economy Venezuela is:
1. completely dollarized, 
2. almost all services are private or privatized, 
3. Economy continues to operate primarily as a commodity exporter of oil to western markets
4. Basically no tariffs or price controls
5. Relative poverty affects up to 80% of the population 
6. Most public schools don't operate full time

replies.author: @TheDarthSebas
replies.text: @presterjohn1697¬† he probably doesn't know any of that. I would love to talk to the "90%" of Venezuelans that he talked to that support the government. Even the people that still support the gov will admit that they have to juggle 3 or 4 jobs to survive, and there has been very little progress in terms of development or improvements. Very interesting that they need to send in some Cuban-American guy to say this insanity, I would be surprised if he found a single Venezuelan who would be willing to say such absurdities The Venezuelan government has lost all allies, domestic and foreign, because of the sheer incompetence and brutal repression they've employed in recent years.
